comments.body: I wonder if we could patch `gstreamer` instead. This seems like a hack.
Maybe, but we could try that on the feedstock :-)

Are you sure this won't result in any hardcoded path later?
Maybe this is easy, like setting a `with-libffi=$PREFIX`, not sure... We need to check the `configure` and `makefile` first.

Yep, we are sure. We've been testing Qt5 internally for more than a month with this package.

Besides, there's no way to set the path to libffi in `configure`. I already checked :-)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +3,7 @@# gstreamer expects libffi to be in lib64 for some reason.
mkdir $PREFIX/lib64
cp -r $PREFIX/lib/libffi* $PREFIX/lib64

# The datarootdir option places the docs into a temp folder that won't

comments.body: Do we have `make check` to run here?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@# why that's happening though.
# make check
make install

# Remove the created lib64 directory

@@ -1,1 +16,20 @@
# Remove the created lib64 directory
rm -rf $PREFIX/lib64

comments.body: Why not `share`? Isn't that the default?

What do you mean?

El 26/08/16 a las 09:39, Filipe escribió:

> In recipes/gstreamer/build.sh 
> https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/1364#discussion_r76429555:
> 
> > @@ -8,6 +8,7 @@ cp -r $PREFIX/lib/libffi\* $PREFIX/lib64
> >  # be included in the package (it is about 12MB).
> >  ./configure --disable-examples --prefix="$PREFIX" --datarootdir=`pwd`/tmpshare
> 
> Why not |share|? Isn't that the default?
>

A `data` directory in Linux us usually $PREFIX/share but now I see that is not what I was thinking... It looks like it is some data bundled in the source instead.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +7,11 @@# The datarootdir option places the docs into a temp folder that won't
# be included in the package (it is about 12MB).
./configure --disable-examples --prefix="$PREFIX" --datarootdir=`pwd`/tmpshare
make
